Posts.Content: Sharon1960 wrote: I had bc nine years ago, BRCA 1 positive, had a double mastectomy, chemo (ACT), reconstructions and oophectomy.  Was fine for seven years and then discovered through CA125 test and further scans that I have bones mets.  I have been on several meds and they seem to work for a couple of months and then my counts starting going up.  At the point where my oncologist wants to put me on intravenous Taxol, which I had with my original diagnosis.  I do not want to experience the same side effects I had last time and am wondering if anyone has had the same experience and how the Taxol is affecting them.  I honestly have been considering not doing the Taxol, but want to explore all avenues.  Thank you so much for any suggestions or help.  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Onc wants me to do Taxol for mets (had Taxol with original dx) Sharon1960 car2tenn

Posts.Content: Feb 3, 2016 09:17AM Sharon1960 wrote: Thanks everyone for replying. Sounds like the Taxol may not be as bad as when I had it the first time. Probably worth a shot.
Posts.Title: Onc wants me to do Taxol for mets (had Taxol with original dx) Sharon1960 car2tenn
